trans-unit.source:
\n

Exposes the client side of an anonymous pipe stream, which supports both synchronous and asynchronous read and write operations.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
An I/O error, such as a disk error, has occurred.

-or-

The stream has been closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx$ xxxx xx x xxxx xxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A string that represents the pipe handle.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A string that represents the pipe handle.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: pipeHandleAsString is not a valid pipe handle.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxXxxxxxXxXxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx x xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The connection is broken or another I/O error occurs.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the pipe transmission mode supported by the current pipe.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x
